text: Historical marker for Fort Wilkinson Fort Wilkinson was a U.S. fort near Milledgeville, Georgia established in 1797 near the Oconee River. It supplanted Fort Fidius. A historical marker commemorates the site. The fort carried out trading relations with Creek peoples. The marker is located on Fort Wilkinson Road. The 1802 Treaty of Fort Wilkinson deals with relations with the Creek. In 1807, the garrison was moved to Ft. Hawkins on the Ocmulgee River. https://georgiahistory.com/ghmi_marker_updated/fort-wilkinson/ ==References== Category:Historical regions Category:Populated places in Georgia (U.S. state)
title: Fort Wilkinson
